edu.umass.cs.gigapaxos

Class PaxosManager<NodeIDType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.gigapaxos.PaxosManager<NodeIDType>
  • Type Parameters:
    NodeIDType -

    PaxosManager is the primary interface to create and use paxos by creating a paxos instance. PaxosManager manages all paxos instances at a node. There is typically one paxos manager per machine. This class could be static, but it is not so that we can test emulations involving multiple "machines" within a JVM. PaxosManager has four functions at a machine that are useful across paxos instances of all applications on the machine: (1) logging, (2) failure detection, (3) messaging, and (4) paxos instance mapping. The fourth is key to allowing the manager to demultiplex incoming messages to the appropriate application paxos instance.


    public class PaxosManager<NodeIDType>
extends Object
    Author:
    V. Arun

    • Constructor Detail

      • PaxosManager

        public PaxosManager(NodeIDType id,
                    edu.umass.cs.nio.interfaces.Stringifiable<NodeIDType> unstringer,
                    edu.umass.cs.nio.interfaces.InterfaceNIOTransport<NodeIDType,org.json.JSONObject> niot,
                    Replicable pi,
                    String paxosLogFolder,
                    boolean enableNullCheckpoints)
        Parameters:
        id - My node ID.
        unstringer - An instance of Stringifiable that can convert String to NodeIDType.
        niot - InterfaceNIOTransport or InterfaceMessenger object used for messaging.
        pi - InterfaceReplicable application controlled by gigapaxos. Currently, all paxos instances must correspond to a single umbrella application even though each createPaxosInstance method explicitly specifies the app and this information is stored explicitly inside a paxos instance. The reason for the single umbrella app restriction is that we won't have a pointer to the appropriate app upon recovery otherwise.
        paxosLogFolder - Paxos logging folder.
        enableNullCheckpoints - Whether null checkpoints are enabled. We need this flag to be enabled if we intend to reconfigure paxos groups managed by this PaxosManager. Otherwise, we can not distinguish between a null checkpoint and no checkpoint, so the next epoch members may be waiting forever for the previous epoch's final state (that happens to be null). This flag needs to be set at construction time and can not be changed thereafter.

        public PaxosManager(NodeIDType id,

    • Method Detail

      • getReplicaGroup

        public Set<NodeIDType> getReplicaGroup(String paxosID,
                                       int version)
        Returns members of this paxos instance if it is active, and null otherwise. Note that this means that we return null even if the paxos instance is being created (but has not yet completed recovery). A non-null answer to this method necessarily means that the paxos instance was ready to take more requests at the time of the query.
        Parameters:
        paxosID - The name of the object or service being managed as a replicated state machine.
        version - The reconfiguration version.
        Returns:
        Set of members in the paxos instance paxosID:version.

      • getReplicaGroup

        public Set<NodeIDType> getReplicaGroup(String paxosID)
        Parameters:
        paxosID -
        Returns:
        Set of members in the paxos instance named paxosID. There can only be one version of a paxos instance at a node, so we don't really have to specify a version unless we want to explicitly get the members for a specific version, in which case, getReplicaGroup(String, int) should be used.

      • createPaxosInstance

        public boolean createPaxosInstance(String paxosID,
                                   Set<NodeIDType> gms,
                                   String initialState)
        A method that specifies the minimum number of necessary arguments to create a paxos instance. The version is assumed to be 0 here. The use of this method is encouraged only if reconfiguration is not desired. The initialState argument can be null if isNullCheckpointStateEnabled() is true.
        Parameters:
        paxosID -
        gms -
        initialState -
        Returns:
        Returns true if the paxos instance paxosID:version or one with a higher version number was successfully created.

        public boolean createPaxosInstance(String paxosID,
                                   int version,
                                   Set<NodeIDType> gms,
                                   Replicable app,
                                   String initialState)
        Paxos instance creation with an initial state specified.
        Parameters:
        paxosID - Paxos group name.
        version - Paxos group version (or epoch number).
        gms - Group members.
        app - Application controlled by paxos.
        initialState - Initial application state.
        Returns:
        Whether this paxos instance or higher got created.

      • proposeStop

        public String proposeStop(String paxosID,
                          int version,
                          String value,
                          ExecutedCallback callback)
        Proposes a request to stop a specific version of paxosID. There is no way to stop a paxos replicated state machine other than by issuing a stop request. The only way to know for sure that the RSM is stopped is by the application receiving the stop request.
        Parameters:
        paxosID -
        value -
        version -
        callback -
        Returns:
        The paxosID:version represented as a String to which this request was proposed.

      • proposeStop

        public String proposeStop(String paxosID,
                          String value,
                          ExecutedCallback callback)
        Stop the paxos instance named paxosID on this machine irrespective of the version. Note that there can be at most one paxos version with a given name on a machine.
        Parameters:
        paxosID -
        value -
        callback -
        Returns:
        The paxosID:version string to which the request was proposed.

      • deleteStoppedPaxosInstance

        public boolean deleteStoppedPaxosInstance(String paxosID,
                                          int version)
        We are only allowed to delete a stopped paxos instance. There is no public method to force-kill a paxos instance other than by successfully creating a paxos instance with the same name and higher version. The only way to stop a paxos instance is to get a stop request committed.
        Parameters:
        paxosID -
        version -
        Returns:
        Returns true if the paxos instance paxosID:version exists and is stopped. If so, the instance will be deleted.

      • getMinResyncDelay

        public long getMinResyncDelay()
        Returns:
        Minimum delay between successive sync decisions for the same paxos instance. This rate limit prevents unnecessary sync'ing under high load when a nontrivial extent of out-of-order-ness is expected.

      • setMinResyncDelay

      • getMaxSyncDecisionsGap

        public int getMaxSyncDecisionsGap()
        Returns:
        Maximum reordering among received decisions that when exceeded prompts a checkpoint transfer as opposed to a sync-decisions operation.

      • createPaxosInstanceForcibly

        public boolean createPaxosInstanceForcibly(String paxosID,
                                           int version,
                                           Set<NodeIDType> gms,
                                           Replicable app,
                                           String state,
                                           long timeout)
        This is a common default create paxos instance creation method, i.e., we wait for lower versions to be killed if necessary but, after a timeout, create the new instance forcibly anyway. This method won't create the instance if the same or higher version already exists. One concern with this method is that force killing lower versions in order to start higher versions can cause the epoch final state to be unavailable at *any* node in immediately lower version. It is okay to kill even an immediately preceding instance only if we already have the necessary state (presumably obtained from a stopped immediately preceding instance at some other group member). In the reconfiguration protocol, we must ensure this by starting a new epoch only after receiving a successful acknowledgment for stopping the previous epoch. However, if say only one node has executed the previous epoch's stop and then starts the new epoch and causes other new epoch replicas to force-create the new epoch, and then crashes, the new epoch is stuck.
        Parameters:
        paxosID -
        version -
        gms -
        app -
        state -
        timeout -
        Returns:
        Returns true if this paxos instance or one with a higher version number was successfully created.

        Parameters:
